_symbol_format: .TICKER YYMMDD P/C STRIKE  (positive qty = buy, negative = sell)
_source: Ravish passive strategies playbook - Zero Risk Collar Strategy
notes: NVDA zero-cost LEAPS collar: long 100 shares + buy 170P + sell call at premium-neutral strike, Jan 2027. 12 months set-and-forget. Downside protected, upside capped.
rationale: Zero-cost collar: buy put for protection, sell call to pay for it. Uses put-call parity to find optimal strikes. Works best where call premium > put premium. Risk-adjusted, capped both sides. For individual top stocks, not indices.

entry_conditions.iv_environment: Works best when call premium is rich relative to puts (call skew). Elevated IV helps both premiums.

put_leg.strike_selection: Choose based on how much downside protection you want. 10% risk tolerance = buy put 10% below current.

examples.aggressive: Buy 140P (27% below 191) — wider range, cheaper put

call_leg.strike_selection: Sell call that generates premium equivalent to put cost. Use put-call parity.
call_leg.note: Goal: net cost of collar is zero (or small credit). Call strike determines your upside cap.

premium_neutral_rule.target: Call premium >= Put premium (zero cost or small credit)
premium_neutral_rule.note: Scan for optimal call strike where call premium equals put premium. Write code to automate this scan.
premium_neutral_rule.market_condition: These days puts are expensive, so opportunities require patience. Best when call skew is favorable.

stock_criteria.note: All collar strategies should be on individual top stocks, NOT indices like S&P 500

entry_conditions.mental_map: Buy long stock. Buy put. Sell call. Make breakeven. Look for call-to-put parity to maximize.
entry_conditions.notes: Zero-Cost LEAPS Collar: buy 100 shares + buy OTM put + sell OTM call where call premium >= put cost. 12 months, set and forget. Downside protected, upside capped. Risk-adjusted strategy — profits are capped but losses are capped. Best on individual top stocks.

pnl_drivers.max_profit: Call strike - stock cost (upside capped at call strike). Example: if call at 210, max profit = (210-191) x 100 = $1,900.
pnl_drivers.max_loss: Stock cost - put strike (downside limited to put strike). Example: if put at 170, max loss = (191-170) x 100 = $2,100.
pnl_drivers.primary_driver: Stock appreciation within the collar range (put strike to call strike)
pnl_drivers.secondary_driver: Zero cost protection — no theta bleed if collar is premium-neutral

greeks_profile.theta: near zero — call theta offsets put theta in premium-neutral collar
greeks_profile.vega: near zero — call vega offsets put vega
greeks_profile.delta: positive but reduced — stock delta 100, put delta ~-25, call delta ~-30 = ~45 net
greeks_profile.gamma: mixed — put positive gamma, call negative gamma

exit_rules.profit_target: Stock at or above call strike. Let expire or close for max profit.
exit_rules.if_called_away: Happy outcome — sold at target price. Redeploy.
exit_rules.if_stock_drops_to_put: Put protects. Can sell put for profit or exercise for floor price.
exit_rules.management: Minimal. Set and forget for 12 months. Check quarterly.

pnl_drivers.ideal_scenario: NVDA stays between 170 and 210 (collar range). At expiry, both options expire worthless if stock near 191. If stock at 210+, called away for $1,900 profit. If stock drops to 170, put protects.
